items.title: Why a G.O.P. Medicaid Requirement Could Set States Up for Failure
items.description: The Republicans’ big bill would require most states to build technology systems quickly and with little funding.

items.title: How Europe Got Tough on Migration
items.description: The European Union has not gone as far as President Trump in cracking down on immigration, but its shift is already profound.

items.title: America Can’t Do to North Korea What It Just Did to Iran
items.description: The Trump administration should embrace a North Korea strategy that aims to contain escalation, not keep a white-knuckled grip on a failed policy.

items.title: Man kicked and injured a CBP beagle during airport baggage search
items.description: An Egyptian traveler who kicked the 25-pound dog was ordered to pay its vet fees and turn himself in for removal from the country.

items.description: Smucker joins a growing number of big food companies that have announced plans to eliminate artificial dyes.

items.title: French Police Officers Who Beat a Black Man on Camera to Stand Trial
items.description: The brutal beating in 2020 of Michel Zecler, a well-known music producer, sent shock waves through France.

items.title: Budapest Pride Parade Was Bigger Than Ever, Despite Orban’s Ban
items.description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s party enacted the ban, but Budapest’s mayor allowed the event to go on. The police sat on the sidelines.

items.description: The over-the-top party in the photogenic Italian city mixed Hollywood, Silicon Valley and political overtones.
